content.description: An elevated left-facing dihedral on the lower tier of the north face.  Fun moves, but still quite chossy.  Anchor around a sturdy tree way in the back on top, with possible gear on the underside of a big boulder kinda out of the way to climber's right.
content.protection: Pro to 3", natural anchor plus optional gear.
content.location: Obvious dihedral to the left of the prominent inverted V of Indecision 2000, about halfway up the gully between Watts Tower and X-Factor Dome.

content.description: Thin face/steep slab climbing will test your footwork and fingers on this challenging and sunny route.
content.location:
Located between an obvious crack on the left (Whoville, 5.8) and

Charles Who?

.

climbs.name: Indecision 2000
climbs.fa: Mark Bowling, Steve Gerberding, Alan Bartlett, 10/2000.

content.description: Up the left side of the inverted V (attempt up the right side found that to be a grainy thin seam with sketchy pro), pull the fun roof, then veer up and left to the top.  Lots of choss and meandering for only a brief bit of fun.  Anchor at a sturdy tree quite far back on top, with possible gear on the underside of a big boulder that's kinda too far to the side to climber's right.
content.protection: Pro to 2.5", natural anchor plus possible gear.
content.location: Up the left side of the prominent inverted V, about halfway up the gully between Watts Tower and X-Factor Dome.

content.description:
This thin and technical seam is a demanding lead with thin placements and tenuous movement; several fixed pins that were on this route are now gone making this more of a challenge.

Shares the bolted anchors with the routes to the left.
content.location:
The thin seam just right of

Charles Who?

.

climbs.name: Freeway Jam
climbs.fa: Roy McClenahan, Alan Roberts, Alan Bartlett, 11/1982.

content.description: Steep and slightly right-slanting thin hands splitter.  Fight the pump sussing out one jam after another, with couple of cool unorthodox ones near the top.  Route tops out onto the highest ledge just below the summit.  Descend via 5.7-ish downclimb to climber's right.  Another short crack recessed toward the back does lead up to the summit.
content.protection: Pro to 1" with an optional 3" piece at the start, gear anchor.
content.location: This crack is the right-most of several cracks on the upper tier of the north face.  Approx 5 mins scramble further up and way back above topout of Indecision 2000 and Runaway Truck Ramp.

climbs.name: Charles Who?
climbs.fa: Randy Vogel, Dave Evans & Rob Raker, February 1987

content.description: Start up a thin flake (pro)  to gain a thin bolted face with nice patina ending at a bolted anchor shared with "Max Factor".
content.protection: 3 bolts (3/8"), gear to 1.5 inches, bolted anchor/rap
content.location:
South face of the formation between

Max Factor

on the left and

Give a Hoot

on the right.

climbs.name: Charles In Charge (aka Who's on First)
climbs.fa: Randy Vogel, Dave Evans, Rob Raker, 2/1987

content.description: Follow the overhanging curving crack of the thick left-facing flake, continue as that turns straight, and finish via easy low-angled terrain toward top.  Lots of big ants on the rock behind the tree, sap below that tree, and a cactus at the start. There are some boulder scrambling to get to the base, so add that to the fairly short approach from the road.
content.location: Left-facing curving flake in front of a tree, located on the right side of a small bulbous buttress on the lower southwest end of X-Factor Dome.
